result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M. Birkhofer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M. Birkhofer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kevin M. Birkhofer
Current: 526 N. Main St, Hancock, WI 54943 United States  (Effective: 05-01-2017)
Prior: 526 N. Main Street, Hancock, WI 54943

Case Called @ 1:25 PM: Defendant Kevin M. Birkhofer in court, in custody, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def states he does not wish an attorney today.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel.   NGP received and entered.  Def states he will remain in custody.  Off Record for Def to speak directly with ADA on resolution.  Back of Record @  1:33 PM:   Per ADA - believes matter has been resolved.  It appears Def will not be able to obtain a valid DL for sometime due to his incarceration.  State recommends Court Costs as penalty.  Def will accept State's offer.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea (OAR):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.   The Court:  Will accepts resolution and imposes as penalty Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Sample to be provided and surcharge assessed if not yet provided.  Def states he did provide sample 3 yrs ago.  Expungement process of DNA w/DOJ ecord explained to Def.  Appeal Rights Given.
Letter from DE asking court for sentence to be lifted, reply from judge if he pays $400 lift sentence then chagne to $100 per mth payment.
Letter from DE asking for balance.
